title: Best Apple Watch for 2026
description: I tested every smartwatch that Apple sells, and here are the best ones to buy based on health features, battery life and your budget.

title: Low-Value Imports Upend E.U. Ecommerce
description:
The surge in imports valued at €150 or less is reshaping the region's online retailing.
The post Low-Value Imports Upend E.U. Ecommerce appeared first on Practical Ecommerce.

title: Genuine Parts split will accelerate B2B digital strategy
description:
Genuine Parts Co.’s decision to separate its automotive and industrial operations into two publicly traded companies is poised to sharpen its B2B ecommerce focus across both sectors. The Atlanta-based distributor said it expects to complete the tax-free separation in the first quarter of 2027. That would create an independent Global Automotive company and a standalone […]
The post Genuine Parts split will accelerate B2B digital strategy appeared first on Digital Commerce 360.

title: Radial launches new Commerce Solutions services for payments and fraud prevention
description:
The fulfillment services and third-party logistics (3PL) provider Radial is adding new payments and fraud prevention options to its portfolio with the launch of Radial Commerce Solutions. Radial — which is in the process of transitioning its identity within the 3PL business unit paxon under the Belgium-based parent company bnode (formerly bpostgroup) — sees the […]
The post Radial launches new Commerce Solutions services for payments and fraud prevention appeared first on Digital Commerce 360.

title: Protolabs launches ProDesk to expand AI quoting and production management
description:
Protolabs has introduced ProDesk, a new online platform, aimed at product development and procurement teams. The company said ProDesk combines automated quoting, artificial intelligence (AI)-powered design analysis and order management tools. It said ProDesk integrates real-time quoting with design for manufacturability, or DFM, analysis across its core services. Protolabs is a Minnesota-based digital manufacturer. Its […]
The post Protolabs launches ProDesk to expand AI quoting and production management appeared first on Digital Commerce 360.

title: Salesforce to acquire Cimulate in agentic commerce expansion
description:
Salesforce has signed a definitive acquisition agreement for Cimulate, an artificial intelligence (AI)-powered product discovery startup. The move aims at strengthening Salesforce’s commerce technology and expanding its push into agent-driven retail experiences. The companies did not disclose financial terms. They expect to close the transaction in the first quarter of Salesforce’s fiscal year 2027, subject […]
The post Salesforce to acquire Cimulate in agentic commerce expansion appeared first on Digital Commerce 360.

title: Pat McGrath Labs secures $30M financing
description: <figure><div><img src="https://imgproxy.divecdn.com/UXloM6hUWXjN25UYUncA09z9nEBko7Ls2tTPMqFabrA/g:ce/rs:fill:1600:900:1/Z3M6Ly9kaXZlc2l0ZS1zdG9yYWdlL2RpdmVpbWFnZS9QTUdfR19TY2FmZm9sZGluZ18wMS5qcGc=.webp"/></div></figure><p>The fresh capital comes from an existing lender. Meanwhile, founder Patricia McGrath will become chief creative officer as part of a Chapter 11 restructuring deal.</p>

title: Kohl’s launches ‘Deal Bar’ in all stores
description: <figure><div><img src="https://imgproxy.divecdn.com/yQhfkv8lJDusbu7C7Xt0ZtXLjEwmkEZFKP-mZHbUNiE/g:nowe:1:21/c:1277:721/rs:fill:1600:900:1/Z3M6Ly9kaXZlc2l0ZS1zdG9yYWdlL2RpdmVpbWFnZS9rb2hsc19zZXBob3JhXzEuanBlZw==.webp"/></div></figure><p>The front-of-store collection of items under $10 could appeal to the department store&rsquo;s financially constrained customers, but is it enough?</p>

title: 6 brands to watch in 2026
description: <p>From Mango to Cyklar, legacy and emerging brands alike are leaning on physical retail to win over customers.</p>

title: DTC rug brand Ernesta opens Dallas showroom
description: <figure><div><img src="https://imgproxy.divecdn.com/gHeKLrbmVV_anoD-0KSuFaIMQhKYjoNEx2hVeoM0rio/g:ce/rs:fill:1600:900:1/Z3M6Ly9kaXZlc2l0ZS1zdG9yYWdlL2RpdmVpbWFnZS9Fcm5lc3RhX1Nob3dyb29tX1dhbGtlcjIuanBn.webp"/></div></figure><p>The 1,256-square-foot space, which features an area for one-on-one consultations, marks the brand&rsquo;s sixth store.</p>

title: Chubbies launches women’s swimwear brand
description: <figure><div><img src="https://imgproxy.divecdn.com/gOzzArX-ITo0WRkvcTD4XIZ5NFkueJOpqoDRDF0Tat8/g:nowe:448:201/c:1701:961/rs:fill:1600:900:1/Z3M6Ly9kaXZlc2l0ZS1zdG9yYWdlL2RpdmVpbWFnZS9DaHViYmllcy5qcGc=.webp"/></div></figure><p>The stand-alone brand, dubbed Cheekies, launches with bikinis, one-piece suits and cover ups priced between $45 and $110.</p>

title: #197: Something Big Is Happening, Claude Safety Risks, AI for Customer Success & High-Profile Resignations
description:
Is the AI disruption we’ve been discussing more prominent than ever? Hosts Paul Roetzer and Mike Kaput dissect Matt Shumer’s viral "Something Big Is Happening" essay and a new sabotage report from Anthropic. We break down the latest departures from OpenAI and xAI, the delay of OpenAI’s device, and how AI is intensifying (not lightening) the modern workload.

Show Notes: Access the show notes and show links here

title: AI Isn’t Cutting Marketing Jobs—But It Is Making Them Harder
description: New data shows layoffs attributed to AI remain limited, even as expectations for faster, higher-volume output have risen.
